title: Watch: These people are all way too old AF to be holding elected office
description:
Mitch McConnell had another deer-in-the-headlight moment when questioned about running for re-election in 2026 yesterday.

"These people [government officials] are senile. This is elder abuse,” Steven said. “Elder abuse is a big problem in this country. Elder abuse takes place at a much higher rate than young people,” Steven said. "McConnell is 81 years old. Which is old for a tortoise."

The video clip showed McConnell struggling to respond to a question about his thoughts on running for re-election.

“That’s uh…” McConnell started to respond but became silent instead. A woman quickly rushed to his side and asked if he heard the question.

He responded “Yes” in a very soft voice but still appeared to be very confused.

title: Furious commuters finally get pushed too far by climate protestors blocking traffic: "We Got Kids To Feed"
description:
Furious commuters clashed with a group of woke climate activists blocking traffic in Washington, D.C. Saturday.

The protest was organized by Declare Emergency, a climate group that believes "billions of people will starve to death in the coming decades" unless the world stops using fossil fuels.

But don’t worry, there is still “two to three years in which we can avert the worst consequences of the climate catastrophe," the group's website states.

title: Yet ANOTHER Public School Teacher Caught Drunk with Students in His Classroom
description:
In case you needed another excuse to get your kids out of public school, a middle school STEM teacher in southern California was arrested last Thursday after staff called police and reported that he was "possibly under the influence of an alcoholic beverage with students in his classroom."

Police reportedly determined that 49-year-old Clifford Harper was intoxicated, and now faces public intoxication and child endangerment charges.
